item.title: Path of Exile 2 is Buffing Loot Drops
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Path of Exile 2 loot drops are increasing based on player feedback for a more rewarding experience.
  • Updates include rarity and quantity bonuses on rare monsters and a system ensuring better loot from Unique bosses.
  • Tweaks to checkpoint fast travel and dodge rolls are in the works to enhance the player experience.

Grinding Gear Games announced that loot drops are increasing in Path of Exile 2 . Since Path of Exile 2 launched in early access, GGG has closely monitored player feedback to address anything that might detract from the experience. The update is being rolled out gradually, and the developer promised to post the patch notes as soon as they're live.

Path of Exile 2 has been available since December 6 for those who purchased the Early Access Supporter Pack. As the name suggests, the game is still in early access, but that hasn't stopped Path of Exile 2 from a successful launch on Steam, peaking at nearly half a million concurrent players. However, as expected from an unfinished game, the action RPG has had its fair share of issues, which GGG has been quick to tackle with prompt hotfixes.

On the official forums, Grinding Gear Games announced that Path of Exile 2 will receive buffed loot drops in response to feedback that the game hasn't felt rewarding enough. The developers emphasized caution with these changes, noting that once drop rates are increased, scaling them back can be tricky if they go too far. One update, already live, addresses rare monsters. The change introduces rarity and quantity bonuses per mod on rare monsters and ensures that as players reach the endgame in Path of Exile 2 , rare monsters will feature even more modifiers.

Another update tackles the issue of Unique bosses dropping poor loot. GGG has implemented an "unlucky" drop protection system, ensuring that Act Bosses and Map Bosses will always drop at least one rare item and that no more than 50% of a Unique monster's drops can be gold. This change is also live, meaning anyone defeating Act Bosses in Path of Exile 2 from today onward is guaranteed rare items.

The patch will also tweak features like checkpoint fast travel and dodge roll adjustments. For checkpoints, players will be able to fast travel between all active checkpoints within an area. Additionally, new checkpoints have been added to zone entrances and exits. As for dodge rolls, many players complained about getting trapped by monsters and subsequently killed. The developer clarified that the intent was to allow monsters to corner players, but adjustments were made to make dodging in Path of Exile 2 take up less space, enabling players to slip through even the smallest gaps. Neither of these features is live yet, but they should arrive in the game soon.

Path of Exile 2 0.1.0c Patch Notes

  • Campaign bosses killed after the first kill will now drop less currency items, replacing them with other items.
  • Increased the drop rate of Regal Orbs.
  • Significantly increased the drop rate of Gemcutter's Prisms.
  • A single Gemcutter's Prism also improves the Quality of a Skill Gem by +5% (previously +1%).
  • Lowered the drop rate of Chaos Orbs and distributed it amongst the other more valued Currency Items (Like Regal Orbs, Exalted Orbs).
  • Lowered the drop rate of Artificer's Orbs and distributed it to Lesser Jeweller's Orbs.
  • Disenchanting Rare Items with 6 Modifiers now provides 2 Regal Shards (previously 1). The value displayed will still show as 1 until a later patch.
  • Increased the values of all Prefix Modifiers that can roll on Waystones. We've also adjusted the chances of getting the more commonly powerful Modifiers such as increases to Rarity and Pack Size.
  • Monster Modifiers now grant higher amounts of Item Rarity and Item Quantity. This is most common on Magic and Rare enemies, but also affects Unique Enemies if applied through various Endgame Mechanics like the Deadly Evolution Keystone.
  • Increased the chance for Rare Monsters in Maps to have 3 or 4 modifiers.
  • Rare Monsters in Map areas are now revealed on the minimap when there are 200 Monsters remaining (previously 50).
  • Fixed a bug where some Persistent Buff Skills, such as Raging Spirits and Mana Remnants, were not working for the Infernalist when in Demon Form.
  • Fixed a bug where you could sometimes be unable to interact with the Map Device in The Ziggurat Refuge.
  • Fixed a bug where Monsters Shattered in a Blood Circle Ultimatum Encounter were not contributing blood.
  • Fixed a bug that could cause the instance to permanently stop time (freeze) when trying to revive a Chronomancer.
  • Fixed a bug where Rare Monsters could not be found within the Chimeral Wetlands.
  • Fixed a bug where "Move only" was name-locking.
  • Fixed three instance crashes.
  • Fixed a client crash.

item.title: Marvel Rivals: Every Vanguard, Ranked
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Vanguards are key frontline powerhouses in Marvel Rivals, crucial for initiating battles and creating opportunities for teammates.
  • Selecting the right Vanguard is essential, each with unique abilities and playstyles that suit different team compositions.
  • Characters like Captain America, Thor, and Groot offer varying strengths and weaknesses, making them essential to master.

Vanguards in Marvel Rivals play a crucial role in any team composition, acting as frontline powerhouses that combine durability with disruptive capabilities. These characters excel at initiating battles, absorbing damage and creating opportunities for their teammates to capitalize on and deal maximum damage. Their presence can often turn the tide of a match, as they dictate both offensive and defensive strategies.

Selecting the right Vanguard is no easy task, though, as each character has their own unique set of abilities that set them apart from each other. Some are better at soaking up damage as tanks, whilst others excel at playing the objective with zonal protection. No matter the preference, Vanguards are an essential class to master, so it's important to understand which ones are the most effective picks.

8 Captain America

Needed More Time In The Ice

  • Health : 650
  • Difficulty : 3/5
  • First Appearance : Captain America Comics #1 (1940)

The First Avenger is probably one of Marvel's most well-known characters, so it might surprise some fans to discover that he's perhaps one of the weakest in Marvel Rivals . He's a melee-focused Vanguard whose kit revolves around his famous shield, which he can raise to protect himself and his allies from damage. However, the shield only has 400 hp, and it gets depleted rather quickly in the heat of battle. At least it reflects projectiles back at enemies, making up for its lower health.

With weaker defensive capabilities compared to other Vanguards, it might then be reasonable to expect that his damage output picks up the slack, but he falters there, too. His movement is excellent, as he dashes and jumps into action quickly, but his attacks are lackluster and more of a nuisance to enemies instead of a serious threat. Even with his Ultimate active, which heals and boosts the movement of his team, he can quickly get overwhelmed by enemy Duelists on objectives.

7 Thor

Lacks The Power Of A God

  • Health : 600
  • Difficulty : 3/5
  • First Appearance : Journey Into Mystery #83 (1962)

The God of Thunder packs a serious punch, as he has some of the highest damage potential among his fellow Vanguards. Thor wields his trusty Mjolnir, which he can use to bash enemies, surge forwards, or throw at longer distances. Players looking to master Thor's kit need to commit to harassing the enemy team as they look to deal high amounts of thunderous damage.

Despite his divine nature, Thor is still far from invincible. He has relatively low health compared to other Vanguards, and it's easy to get stranded thanks to his limited movement options. Unless he's awakened, which grants him 200 extra hp, it's unlikely that he'll be able to be the face of the attack for sustained periods of time.

6 Bruce Banner / The Hulk

Decent Damage But Easily Thwarted By Duelists

  • Health : 200 / 800 / 1550
  • Difficulty : 4/5
  • First Appearance : The Incredible Hulk #1 (1962)

The Hulk can come across as a simple character at times, appearing as an angry green giant, but the developers of Marvel Rivals gave him more nuance. He has three forms which players can switch between by building his Ultimate: Bruce Banner, Hero Hulk, and Monster Hulk. The playstyles vary between each rendition, with Bruce Banner having a Gamma Ray Gun to shoot at enemies, whilst Hero Hulk is focused on getting up close and personal.

He's a tricky character to master (hence the difficulty rating), and managing his forms can be frustrating at times, especially when deforming back into Bruce Banner. His damage is decent, but it's his range and speed that let him down, as any Duelist with a bit of range to their attacks can drop Hero Hulk back to Bruce in a few hits. From there, he's a sitting duck ready to get eliminated.

5 Groot

A Well-Rounded Vanguard Who Can Control The Map

  • Health : 850
  • Difficulty : 2/5
  • First Appearance : Tales To Astonish #13 (1960)

Though he might appear simple at first, there's a unique level of complexity to playing Groot. His abilities allow him to place thorny walls across the map, meaning he can partition off objectives or funnel enemies through certain areas. They can double as much-needed cover in open areas, and when Groot stands near them and attacks, they grant bonus damage to enemies or healing to allies.

As far as his health goes, it's nothing to scoff at either. With 850 hp and ways to regain it himself, Groot is quite self-sustainable, making him a perfect anchor for an objective. Partner him with a well-played healer, and he should be able to hold objectives fairly well. His key limiting factor is his normal attack, which does decent damage but lacks a chance for critical hits. Otherwise, he's an incredibly well-rounded Vanguard worthy of a spot on the team.

4 Peni Parker

Queen Of The Spider Bots

  • Health : 650
  • Difficulty : 4/5
  • First Appearance : Edge Of Spider-Verse #5 (2014)

Peni Parker is perhaps the best character in Marvel Rivals for zone denial. Her Bionic Spider Nest ability coats an area with Cyber-Webs, which grant Healing Over Time and a Movement Boost. So long as this is placed somewhere out of view for enemies to destroy, Peni can easily anchor an objective. That being said, if the Spider Nest is destroyed, Peni can get singled out due to her large frame and relatively lower health for a Vanguard. It's important to keep it guarded at all times, something Peni should be capable of doing with her heavy blasting cannons.

Within her Cyber-Webs, Spider-Drones are dispersed, and Peni can also shoot these out fairly frequently. When they're placed in tricky spots, they can easily catch an enemy unaware and deal decent damage, especially if they're stacked in a high-traffic area. Her Ultimate allows her to clear and claim an objective by placing Cyber-Webs and launching enemies into the air, making them an easy target for friendly Duelists to pick out.

3 Magneto

Use Metal For Protection And Destruction

  • Health : 650
  • Difficulty : 2/5
  • First Appearance : X-Men #1 (1963)

Magneto strikes a perfect balance between a defensive and offensive character. He can summon a Metallic Curtain, which blocks all incoming projectiles, and it's wide enough to cover him and some allies. It doesn't have a health bar like Captain America or Doctor Strange, instead relying on a short cooldown, so players need to ensure they won't be under fire by the time it runs out, as movement is fairly restricted.

If players want individual protection, then Magneto can summon shields around allies and himself, with the damage taken being transformed into metallic rings on Magneto's back. These rings can be converted into a Mag-Cannon, which deals decent damage at range, and his Ultimate is excellent at dealing heavy damage to a group of enemies in a cluster.

2 Doctor Strange

Shield Bearer And Portal Maker

  • Health : 650
  • Difficulty : 2/5
  • First Appearance : Strange Tales #110 (1963)

The Sorcerer Supreme reigns supreme when it comes to tanking damage on the frontline. His Shield Of The Seraphim ability projects a gigantic circular shield with 800 hp that blocks all incoming projectiles. Strange can also levitate for short periods of time, meaning he can even protect airborne players should they need it. It's his utility that makes him stand out though, as he can summon a portal across the map, allowing allies to quickly navigate the battlefield or trick enemies into a death trap.

He doesn't slack when it comes to offense, though, as his normal attacks deal consistent damage that charge up a powerful blast that can hit numerous enemies at once. His Ultimate is respectable, too, as it separates enemies' souls from their bodies, with damage done to them transferring over to their physical selves.

1 Venom

Symbiotically Stall The Whole Team

  • Health : 800
  • Difficulty : 1/5
  • First Appearance : The Amazing Spider-Man #300 (1988)

Venom is the perfect mesh between a tank and a DPS-focused character, and he's suited to frontline any team in Marvel Rivals . With 800 health and the ability to regen some in an instant, Venom is incredibly self-sufficient in the heat of combat. If the going gets tough, he can always swing away with his rapid movement, something plenty of other Vanguards lack.

His movement isn't just good for fleeing though, as it's used especially well to instigate fights with unsuspecting enemies. Partner that with his Cellular Corrosion ability that slows enemies and his normal attack that deals a great amount of damage, and Venom can single-handedly disrupt a group of enemies all on his own. With the right player at the helm, Venom can be nigh on immortal, and a serious threat to any enemy team.

item.title: Rumor: Possible PlayStation Game Awards 2024 Announcement Leaked
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Days Gone Remastered announcement is rumored for The Game Awards 2024.
  • The remaster was previously leaked by reputable insiders.
  • Whether it's announced at The Game Awards on Thursday remains to be seen, however.

According to the latest rumors, it seems as though a Days Gone Remastered announcement could be taking place at The Game Awards 2024. This isn't the first time that there have been rumblings about a potential Days Gone remaster, but the rumored project still has yet to be officially announced to the masses.

Days Gone was first released in 2019, and unlike most Sony first-party games, it earned mixed reviews and proved to be a rather divisive release. Despite the mixed reaction, there are many who enjoyed the open world zombie game and were disappointed to learn that the sequel pitch was apparently rejected by Sony. While Days Gone 2 may never happen, it seems fans of the original may soon have the chance to revisit it with some enhancements.

It's possible that the long-rumored Days Gone remaster is going to be announced at The Game Awards 2024. We know that the Days Gone remaster exists thanks to reports by reputable insiders, though whether it will be revealed at The Game Awards on December 12 is still up for debate. However, it was pointed out on Resetera that the Steam version of Days Gone has seemingly received updates as of late, with the latest activity occurring on December 9. Not only that, but the current version of Days Gone is on sale, with that sale ending on December 12, the same day as The Game Awards. Now, this might all be nothing more than coincidences, but it has nonetheless fueled the rumors that the Days Gone remaster is going to be announced at The Game Awards.

Days Gone Remaster Rumored for The Game Awards

If a Days Gone remaster is announced at The Game Awards, it will be interesting to see what it brings to the table. Like the Horizon Zero Dawn remaster, fans may be wondering what exactly the point of a Days Gone remaster is. After all, Days Gone is already playable on PS5 through the console's backward compatibility with PS4, plus the game is also already available on PC.

Perhaps a Days Gone remaster will fix the bugs that plagued the original game and deliver a more polished experience that fans expect from first-party PlayStation games. Maybe this could be Days Gone 's second chance at a first impression, potentially increasing interest in the IP. Even if that happens, though, fans shouldn't hold their breath for a Days Gone sequel, as developer Bend Studio is reportedly busy working on a new live-service IP.

item.title: Destiny 2 Weekly Reset: New Nightfall, Challenges, and Rewards
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Weekly Nightfall and Modifiers
  • Episode: Revenant Challenges
  • Exotic Mission Rotation
  • Raid and Dungeon Rotation
  • Raid Challenges
  • Ritual Activities: Crucible and Gambit
  • Legacy Activities and Challenges
  • Dares of Eternity Rotation
  • Xur Details
  • Trials of Osiris Map and Weekly Adept Weapon

Updated December 10, 2024: Another week has come for Destiny 2 , which means missions, challenges, and rewards have been reset. It's a big week in Destiny 2 as The Dawning has arrived for its annual appearance. The Holiday event brings back cookie baking, though this year, players can take part in a community baking challenge to help unlock 3 rare emblems.

Alongside, this week's reset also released a new update, providing a long-awaited fix for an issue where Tomb of Elders tonics were broken, essentially providing a drop boosting effect to the incorrect weapon. While that problem may now be settled, Bungie continues to work on resolutions for a number of other issues including a broken exotic item and a Titan subclass that is hitting harder than anticipated.

Alongside The Dawning, the Destiny 2 weekly reset has arrived, bringing with it the usual refreshed content, activities, and rewards for players to chase over the next week. For a complete look at all the new content available for the week of December 10, including Nightfalls, Crucible modes, and challenges, here is everything players need to know.

Weekly Nightfall and Modifiers

Nightfall Strike : Birthplace of the VIle

Advanced Modifiers:

  • Champions : Overload and Unstoppable
  • Hero Modifiers: Extra Shields. Solar, Void, and Arc.
  • Galvanized : Combatants have more health and are more difficult to stun.
  • Overcharge : Fusion Rifle and Kinetic Weapons when the player's subclass matches an active Surge element.
  • Threat : Void
  • Surge : Void and Arc

Expert Modifiers:

  • All previous modifiers.
  • Equipment Locked : Unable to change equipment once the mission starts.
  • Randomized Banes : Combatants are granted random Banes.
  • Expert Modifiers : Extra Shields

Master Modifiers:

  • All previous modifiers.
  • Brawn : Your health is massively increased but does not regenerate. Defeating challenging combatants will recover health for you and nearby allies.
  • Master Modifiers : Locked Loadout, Extra Champions, and Extra Shields.

Grandmaster Modifiers:

  • All previous modifiers.
  • Chaff: Radar is disabled.
  • Grandmaster Modifiers : Extinguish, Limited Revives, Join In Progress Disabled, Contest, Locked Loadout, Extra Champions, and Extra Shields.

_______________________________________________________________

  • Nightfall Weapon : Scintillation (Linear Fusion Rifle)

Episode: Revenant Challenges

Week 10

  • Taking All Challengers - Complete Onslaught: Salvation on Expert difficulty.
  • Near Orbit - Create 200 Orbs of Power in Episode: Revenant activities.
  • Trial by Firing Squad - Win Multiple (20) rounds in the Trials of Osiris.
  • Mid-Range Calibration - Calibrate mid-range weapons: Hand Cannons, Glaives, Auto Rifles, Fusion Rifles, and Machine Guns. Bonus progress for defeating Guardians.

Exotic Mission Rotation

Bungie brought back various exotic missions for players to run through to earn new rewards, gear, as well as craftable versions of exotic weapons. Like the Raid and Dungeon rotator, this one changes on a weekly basis.

Featured Exotic Mission : NODE.OVRD.AVALON (Vexcalibur Glaive)

Raid and Dungeon Rotation

Originally introduced during Season 17, Bungie features Raids and Dungeons in a weekly rotation to make them farmable with updated rewards. Starting in Episode: Revenant, Bungie is making 2 of each available in the featured rotation each week:

  • Featured Raid : Garden of Salvation and King's Fall
  • Featured Dungeon : Pit of Heresy and Spire of the Watcher

Raid Challenges

  • Salvation's Edge : Coordinated Efforts
  • Deep Stone Crypt : Red Rover
  • Vow of the Disciple : Defenses Down
  • Vault of Glass : Out of Its Way
  • King's Fall : The Grass Is Always Greener, Devious Thievery, Gaze Amaze, Under Construction, Hands Off
  • Root of Nightmares : Crossfire
  • Garden of Salvation : A Link to the Chain, Leftovers, To The Top, Zero to One Hundred
  • Last Wish : Which Witch

Ritual Activities: Crucible and Gambit

Players can earn additional rewards through Destiny 2 's Pathfinder system simply by playing and performing certain tasks in ritual activities like Vanguard Strikes, Crucible, and Gambit.

Legacy Activities and Challenges

Europa

  • Exo Challenge : Simulation: Safeguard
  • Eclipsed Zone : Cadmus Ridge
  • Empire Hunt : Praksis, The Technocrat

Neomuna

  • Incursion Zone : Liming Harbor
  • Campaign Mission : No Time Left
  • Partition: Hard Reset

Throne World

  • Weekly Story Mission : The Communion
  • Altars of Reflection : Weekly activity that players can take on through specifically marked icons within the Throne World. These missions typically involve light puzzle solving as well as battling enemy combatants.

The Moon

  • Trove Guardian: Hellmouth
  • Wandering Nightmare: Fallen Council (Archer's Line)
  • Campaign : In The Deep

Nightmare Rotation:

  • Taniks (Isolation)
  • Skolas (Pride)
  • Zydron (Servitude)

Dreaming City

  • The Dreaming City Curse Level : High - The Dark Monastery mission
  • Petra Venj Location : Rheasilvia
  • The Blind Well : Taken enemies - Plague: Inomina
  • Ascendant Challenge : Keep of Honed Edges (Harbinger's Seclude)

Dares of Eternity Rotation

  • Round 1 : Hive
  • Round 2 : Vex
  • Final Round : Valus Ta'aurc

Xur Details

Xur, the exotic merchant of Destiny 2 , arrives every weekend until reset, giving players a short window to check out what he has in stock. With The Final Shape, Xur has seen a rework of what is on offer. Here's what the merchant has for the weekend of 12/6:

  • Promethium Spur (Warlock leg armor)
  • Ophidia Spathe (Hunter chest armor)
  • Dunemarchers (Titan leg armor)
  • Sweet Business (Auto Rifle)
  • Graviton Lance (Pulse Rifle)
  • The Colony (Heavy Grenade Launcher)
  • Hawkmoon (Hand Cannon)
  • Vigilance Wing Catalyst
  • Le Monarque Catalyst
  • The Xurfboard (Skimmer Board Vehicle)
  • Essentialism/Stoicism/Solipsism OR Exotic Cipher
  • Exotic Engram
  • Ascendant Alloy
  • Glimmer
  • Enhancement Core
  • Vanguard Engram
  • Strange Gift (Random Item for 1 Strange Coin)
  • Nightshade (Kinetic Pulse Rifle)
  • A Distant Pull (Kinetic Sniper Rifle)
  • Tarnished Mettle (Energy Scout Rifle)
  • Bug-Out Bag (Energy Submachine Gun)
  • Tarantula (Heavy Linear Fusion Rifle)
  • Memory Interdict (Heavy Grenade Launcher)
  • Crown-Splitter/Quickfang/Eternity's Edge (Heavy Sword)
  • Strange Weapon Engram
  • Lost Pacific Armor Set

Make sure to check back every Friday for a comprehensive breakdown of all the new exotic gear and rolls that Xur brings to Destiny 2 .

Trials of Osiris Map and Weekly Adept Weapon

Saint-14 and the Trails of Osiris offer players a high-end PvP activity in exchange for powerful rewards, especially for players who go flawless and earn a trip to the Lighthouse. Similar to most vendors in Destiny 2 , Saint-14 has a reputation system that rewards players for ranking up through playing and completing bounties.

No Trials of Osiris for 12/6. Iron Banner is active!

  • Map : N/A
  • Weapon : N/A

item.title: Nintendo Switch 2's Leaked Big Hardware Upgrade Explained
item.description:
The Nintendo Switch 2 has been on a lot of gamers' minds lately, as an announcement feels like it could happen any day now. Nintendo has kept a lot of details regarding the Switch 2 under wraps, but the latter half of this year has brought forth an onslaught of leaks and rumors about the anticipated console. From size to magnetic Joy-Cons, the Switch 2 has been the subject of much speculation, and a recent rumor claiming to have knowledge of the console's RAM is one of the newest pieces of potential insight.

If these new rumors are true, then Nintendo's next console is going to be getting a serious hardware upgrade compared to its predecessor. Reported by ComicBook, leaked shipment details that supposedly list the specs of the Switch 2 claim that the console could possibly have 12GB of RAM. When comparing this RAM to the current Switch, this successor could potentially hold 3x more power. The current Switch's 4GB of RAM could pale in comparison, but this has yet to be officially confirmed by Nintendo.

Nintendo's Next Console Could Be Three Times More Powerful Than the Switch

The Switch 2 Could Be One of Nintendo's Most Powerful Consoles Yet

The Switch has had an impressively long lifespan. This success cannot be understated, but unfortunately, the console is beginning to show its age. Closing in on its eighth year, the performance of the Switch can sometimes be subpar with certain games due to its processor, but a boost in RAM for its successor is a promising sign, if true. Leaks about the Switch 2 have been rampant for the past few months, but these rumors pointing toward more RAM is one of the most exciting developments for gamers who are hoping for a more powerful Nintendo product.

How the Current Switch's RAM Compares to Other Consoles

Console

RAM

Nintendo Switch

4GB

PlayStation 5

16GB

PlayStation 5 Pro

18GB

Xbox Series X

16GB

Xbox Series S

10GB

If the Switch 2 really does boast such an impressive upgrade with 12GB of RAM, it brings the console a little bit closer to the performance levels of the standard PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X. Even more impressive, though, is that 12 GB of RAM for the Switch 2 would mean it's more powerful than the Xbox Series S, which would be significant. While such an upgrade may not be hugely felt by PlayStation 5 and Xbox fans, those who solely play games on the Switch could be in store for a major improvement. With reports of the Switch 2's production increasing, 2025 could be a huge year for Nintendo fans.

Recent leaks also claim the Switch 2 will be larger and feature an LCD screen as its display.

The Nintendo Switch 2 Could Add to an Already Stacked 2025

Nintendo has yet to confirm a release date for the Switch 2, but theories and speculations have predicted the latter half of 2025. Despite there being no official release date yet, Nintendo has at least confirmed that the company will announce its next console by the end of March 2025. Between that and the confirmation of the Switch 2's backward compatibility, Nintendo fans already have a lot to be excited about. As March draws closer, it will eventually be confirmed if the Switch 2 boasts 12GB of RAM or not, but until then, such leaks should be taken lightly.

However, if Nintendo confirms the recent flow of rumors and leaks and sets a 2025 release date in place, the company will be adding to a year that is already poised to be a massive time for gaming. These upcoming months are hopefully going to be filled with a lot of exciting announcements from Nintendo, and one of the most fascinating points of interest is seeing how much more powerful the Switch 2 is than its predecessor.
